paper.title: The first BOWS Contest (Break Our Watermarking System)
paper.venue: Conference on Security, Steganography, and Watermarking of Multimedia Contents
paper.publisher: International Society for Optics and Photonics
paper.abstract: In the framework of the activities carried out by the European Network of Excellence for Cryptology ECRYPT, a of :[18],"excellence funded within the Information Societies Technology (IST) Programme of the European :[32],"Framework Programme (FP6), it was proposed to launch the BOWS Contest. BOWS, acronym of Break :[48],"System, was designed to allow to investigate how and when an image watermarking system can be :[65],"preserving the highest possible quality of the modified content, in case that the watermarking system is subjected :[83],"world-wide attack. BOWS contest was not intended as an attempt to prove how well-performing a watermarking :[100],"but it was expected by means of this test to better understand which are the disparate possible attacks, perhaps the :[120],"moment of the start of the contest, the BOWS participants could carry out to perform their action and this :[140],"way the degree of difficulty of breaking the embedded watermark. This paper describes how the Contest has and :[159],"analyzes the general progress of the attacks during the Contest.
